content:
Yes, here are some affordable neighborhoods outside of the city center in Leiden:

1. Merenwijk: This neighborhood is located to the northeast of the city center and is a very popular residential area for families. There are several parks and green spaces, as well as easy access to shops and amenities. 2. Stevenshof: Located to the west of the city center, this neighborhood has a mix of residential houses and apartment buildings with plenty of green spaces and parks. 3. Cronesteyn: This neighborhood, located to the south of the city center, has many green spaces, including a large park with a lake, making it a great option for nature lovers. 4. De Kooi: Located to the east of the city center, this neighborhood has a mix of residential and commercial properties and is home to the largest market in Leiden. It has good access to public transportation and is a relatively affordable area. 5. Zeeheldenbuurt: This neighborhood is located to the northwest of the city center and is known for its historic architecture and charming streets. It is a popular area for students and is located close to Leiden University's Science Campus. These neighborhoods offer a good balance between affordable housing and proximity to amenities and public transportation, making them a great option for those looking to save money on rent while still enjoying all that Leiden has to offer.
